properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: LAUNDRY ROOM NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: CARBON MONOXIDE MISSING THROUGHOUT HALLWAYS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: SMOKE DETECTOR HALLWAYS MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: MISSING SMOKE DETECTORS IN BUILDING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR IN BUILDING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR MISSING BATTERY 2ND FLOOR CORRIDOR
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: BASEMENT - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECOR - BEEPING
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: UNITS #1503, 1109 - CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS - MISSING
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: ENTIRE BUILDING-NO SMOKE DETECTORS
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: ENTIRE BUILDING-NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTORS
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

Register vacant building.  Mortgagees must register vacant property within 30 days of vacancy or within 60 days of default. (Sec. 13-12-126(a).) See vacant Building Registration Form at: https://ipiweb.cityofchicago.org/VBR.

Board and Secure vacant building.  Mortgagees must board and secure vacant buildings within 30 days of vacancy or within 60 days of default.    (Sec. 13-12-126(b).)  See vacant Building Registration Form at:  https://ipiweb.cityofchicago.org/VBR.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: LOWER LEVEL/ ELECTRICAL METER ROOM AND KITCHEN - MISSING SMOKE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.
properties.ADDRESS: 4849 S DR MARTIN L KING JR DR
properties.FULL_ADDR: 4849 S DR MARTIN LUTHER KING JR DR

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: LOWER LEVEL/ ELECTRICAL METER ROOM AND KITCHEN - MISSING CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.FULL_ADDR: 4849 S DR MARTIN LUTHER KING JR DR

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 1ST FLOOR CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR MISSING.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: 2ND. FL. DWELLING UNIT /CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR - MISSING;
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: THIS IS A VERY LARGE MULTI-UNIT APARTMENT BUILDING WITH SEVERAL STAIR SYSTEMS AND VERY LONG (300' PLUS) CORRIDORS. THE FOLLOWING VITAL (FOR SAFETY) ITEMS MUST BE PROVIDED, AS NEW, TO REPLACE THE EXISTING INOPERABLE OR MISSING SYSTEMS.EXIT SIGNAGE / ILLUMINATION ... THERE ARE MULTIPLE EXIT SIGNS EITHER MISSING, INOPERABLE OR NEVER ORIGINALLY INSTALLED IN THE STAIRWELLS, CORRIDORS AND BASMENT. ALSO, THE EXISTING EXIT LIGHTING IS EITHER INOPERABLE, MISSING OR WAS NEVER INSTALLED IN THE STAIRWELLS, CORRIDORS AND BASEMENT. ALSO, THE SYSTEM III EMERGENCY LIGHTING SYSTEM HAS NUMEROUS INOPERABLE AND MISSING FIXTURES AT THE STAIRWELLS, BASEMENT AND THE CORRIDORS. SECTION 10(13-160-700) TO 10(13-160-750). DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS.THE STAIRWELL AND CORRIDOR DOORS AS WELL AS ALL BASEMNT DOORS ARE NOT FIRE RATED. MANY OF THESE DOORS ARE MISSING LATCH HARDWARE, SELF CLOSING DEVICES AND DO NOT FIT FLUSH INTO THE DOOR FRAMES DUE TO HINGE DAMAGE. THESE VITAL (FOR SAFETY) DOORS MUST BE REPLACED WITH NEW. THE BASEMENT MECHANICAL ROOMS (ELECTRICAL AND PLUMBING) ARE OPEN WITHOUT FUNCTIONING DOORS ... ALLOWING FOR TENANT ACCESS TO DANGEROUS AREAS. SECTION 10(13-160-250 TO SECTION 10(13-160-270).THE SYSTEMS MENTIONED ARE IN A STATE OF DISREPAIR AND CREATE AN ONGOING DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS SITUATION FOR THE TENEANTS OF THIS BUILDING. PERMIT REQUIRED.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Provide

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: THE WEST ELEVATION STAIR SYSTEM HAS A METAL FRAMEWORK THAT IS SO BADLY CORRODED THAT IT MUST BE CONSIDERED DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS. THE STAIR STRINGERS, BANISTERS AND THE STRUCTURAL FRAMEWORK SUPPORTING THE STAIR LANDINGS ARE SEVERELY RUSTED DUE TO LONG TERM WATER PENETRATION FROM THE ROOF AND PLUMBING SYSTEMS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Failed to maintain interior stairway system in safe condition and sound repair. (13-196-570)

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NOT A SINGLE SMOKE DETECTOR WAS OBSERVED DURING THE INSPECTION OF THIS VERY LARGE RESIDENTIAL BUILDING WITH NUMEROUS STAIR WELLS AND 300' LONG CORRIDORS. DANGEROUS AND HAZARDOUS.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install and maintain approved smoke detectors. (13-196-100 thru 13-196-160) Install a smoke detector in every dwelling unit. Install one on any living level with a habitable room or unenclosed heating plant, on the uppermost ceiling of enclosed porch stairwell, and within 15 feet of every sleeping room. Be sure the detector is at least 4 inches from the wall, 4 to 12 inches from the ceiling, and not above door or window.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: NO CARBON MONOXIDE DETECTOR IN THE BASEMENT LAUNDRY ROOM.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Install carbon monoxide detector within 40 feet of every sleeping room in residential structure. (13-64-190, 13-64-210) A carbon monoxide detector is needed whenever there is a heating appliance on the premises that burns fossil fuel such as gas, oil, or coal, or air that is circulated through a heat exchanger. Install according to manufacturer instructions. A hard wired model requires an electrical wiring permit. In a single family residence, be sure the detector is on or below the lowest floor with a place to sleep. In a multiple dwelling residence heated by a boiler, install a detector in the same room as the boiler. Otherwise, each apartment follows single family guidelines. The owner is responsible for installation and written instructions, the tenant for testing, maintenance, and batteries.

properties.VIOLATION.INSPECTOR.COMMENTS: THIS IS AN APPROXIMATELY 100 UNIT, 5 STORY APARTMENT BUILDING WITH MULTIPLE STAIR SYSTEMS AND VERY LONG (300') CORRIDORS. THE BUILDING IS NOT SECURE DUE TO NO LOCK HARDWARE ON THE FRONT DOOR. NOT A SINGLE SMOKE DETECTOR WAS OBSERVED IN ANY OF THE COMMON AREAS. THE NUEROUS MISSING / INOPERABLE EXIT SIGNS, EXIT LIGHTS AND EMERGENCY LIGHT FIXTURES IS A SERIOUS SAFETY DEFICIENCY. THE LACK OF FUNCTIONING STAIRWELL, CORRIDOR AND BASEMENT FIRE DOORS IS ALSO A SERIOUS SAFETY DEFICIENCY. THE BASEMNT ELECTRICAL ROOM IS WIDE OPEN WITH EASY ADULT / CHILD ACCESS TO THIS EXTREMELY DANGEROUS AREA. THE SUMP PUMP MECHANICAL ROOM IN THIS BASEMENT IS ALSO WIDE OPEN WITH EASY ADULT / CHILD ACCESS TO THIS ROOM THAT HAS A VERY DEEP / WIDE / WATER FILLED SUMP PIT THAT IS ONLY PARTIALLY COVERED. THE FREIGHT ELEVATER DOOR IS STUCK OPEN WITH EASY CHILD / ADULT ACCESS TO A POTENTIALLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. THE WEST INTERIOR STAIRWELL IS RUSTED AND DANEROUS. THERE ARE LARGE AREAS OF STAIRWELLS AND CORRIDORS THAT LACK ANY EXIT ILLUMINATION WHAT SO EVER. THE EXTREME NATURE OF THESE BASIC SAFETY FEATURES BEING EITHER MISSING OR INOPERABLE PRESENTS A HAZARD TO BOTH THE TENANTS AND EMERGENCY PERSONELL LIKE CPD AND CFD.
properties.VIOLATION.ORDINANCE: Make repairs to building rapidly becoming dangerous, and to bring and maintain in good and safe condition, or wreck part that endangers life and property. (13-12-130, 13-8-100)
